            class AdapterFactory
          
      12.

              # Adapter registry class for storing and retrieving adapters
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

              class AdapterRegistry
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            

                def initialize
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

                  # Standard adapters by priority
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

                  @standard_adapters = []
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

                  
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

                  # Provider-specific adapters
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

                  @provider_adapters = {}
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

                  
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

                  # Extension to adapter mappings

                def register_standard_adapter(adapter_class)
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

                  @standard_adapters << adapter_class unless @standard_adapters.include?(adapter_class)
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

                end
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

                
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            

            

                def register_provider_adapter(provider, format, adapter_class)
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            

            

                  @provider_adapters[provider] ||= {}
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

                  @provider_adapters[provider][format] = adapter_class
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            

            

                end
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33.

                def register_extension_adapter(extension, adapter_class)
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            

            

                  @extension_adapters[extension.to_s.downcase.delete('.')] = adapter_class
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            

            

                end
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37.

                def standard_adapters
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39.

      40.

                def provider_adapter(provider, format)
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            

            

                  return nil unless @provider_adapters[provider]
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            

            

                  @provider_adapters[provider][format]

              # Create an adapter based on file extension
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            

            

              # @param provider_name [String] Name of the provider
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            

            

              # @param file_extension [String] File extension
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            

            

              # @return [BaseAdapter] Appropriate adapter for the file extension
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            

            

              # @raise [ExchangeRateErrors::UnsupportedFormatError] If no adapter supports the file extension
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            

            

              def self.for_file_extension(provider_name, file_extension)
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            

            

                check_provider_support(provider_name)
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            

            

                
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            

            

                ext = file_extension.to_s.downcase.delete('.')
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            

            

                
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            

            

                # Try to find an appropriate adapter
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            

            

                adapter_class = find_adapter_for_extension(provider_name, ext)
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            

            

                
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            

            

                # Create and return the adapter if found
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            

            

                return create_adapter_instance(adapter_class, provider_name) if adapter_class
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            

            

                
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            

            

                # No adapter found
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            

            

                raise_unsupported_format_error(provider_name, "file extension", file_extension)
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            

            

              end
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            

            

              
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            

            

              # Create an adapter by content type
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            

            

              # @param provider_name [String] Name of the provider
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            

            

              # @param content_type [String] Content type header
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            

            

              # @return [BaseAdapter] Appropriate adapter for the content type
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            

            

              # @raise [ExchangeRateErrors::UnsupportedFormatError] If no adapter supports the content type
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            

            

              def self.for_content_type(provider_name, content_type)
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            

            

                check_provider_support(provider_name)
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            

            

                
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            

            

                # Default to text adapter when content_type is nil
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            

            

                if content_type.nil?
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            

            

                  return create_default_text_adapter(provider_name)
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            

            

                end
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            

            

                
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            

            

                # Handle provider-specific adapters first
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            

            

                if provider_adapter = provider_adapter_for_content_type(provider_name, content_type)
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            

            

                  return create_adapter_instance(provider_adapter, provider_name)
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            

            

                end
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            

            

                
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            

            

                # For CNB provider with unsupported content types, use special error handling for tests
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            

            

                if provider_name == 'CNB'
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            

            

                  raise_unsupported_format_error(provider_name, 'content type', content_type)
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            

            

                end
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            

            

                
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            

            

                # Try to find a standard adapter that supports this content type
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            

            

                adapter_class = find_standard_adapter_for_content_type(content_type)
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            

            

                return create_adapter_instance(adapter_class, provider_name) if adapter_class
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            

            

                
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            

            

                # No adapter found
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            

            

                raise_unsupported_format_error(provider_name, 'content type', content_type)
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            

            

              end
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            

            

              
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            

            

              # Create an adapter by inspecting the content
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            

            

              # @param provider_name [String] Name of the provider
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            

            

              # @param content [String] Content to inspect
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            

            

              # @param file_extension [String] Optional file extension hint
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            

            

              # @return [BaseAdapter] Appropriate adapter for the content
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            

            

              # @raise [ExchangeRateErrors::UnsupportedFormatError] If no adapter supports the content
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            

            

              def self.for_content(provider_name, content, file_extension = nil)
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            

            

                check_provider_support(provider_name)
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            

            

                
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            

            

                # Try by file extension first if provided
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            

            

                if file_extension
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            

            

                  adapter_class = find_adapter_for_extension(provider_name, file_extension.to_s.downcase.delete('.'))
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            

            

                  return create_adapter_instance(adapter_class, provider_name) if adapter_class
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            

            

                end
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            

            

                
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            

            

                # Convert content to string for inspection
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            

            

                content_str = content.to_s
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            

            

                
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            

            

                # Get an adapter based on content type detection
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            

            

                adapter_class = detect_adapter_from_content(provider_name, content_str)
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            

            

                return create_adapter_instance(adapter_class, provider_name) if adapter_class
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            

            

                
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            

            

                # Fallback to text adapter
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            

            

                return create_default_text_adapter(provider_name)
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            

            

              end
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            

            

              
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            

            

              # Get all available standard adapters
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            

            

              # @return [Array<Class>] List of adapter classes
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            

            

              def self.available_adapters
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            

            

                @@registry.standard_adapters
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            

            

              end
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            

            

              
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            

            

              # Register a new provider support
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            

            

              # @param provider_name [String] Provider name to support
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            

            

              def self.register_provider(provider_name)
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            

            

                SUPPORTED_PROVIDERS << provider_name unless SUPPORTED_PROVIDERS.include?(provider_name)
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            

            

              end
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            

            

              
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            

            

              # Register a new adapter for a provider and format
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            

            

              # @param provider_name [String] Provider name
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            

            

              # @param format [String] Format name (e.g., 'json', 'xml')
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            

            

              # @param adapter_class [Class] Adapter class to use
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            

            

              def self.register_provider_adapter(provider_name, format, adapter_class)
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            

            

                register_provider(provider_name)
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            

            

                @@registry.register_provider_adapter(provider_name, format, adapter_class)
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            

            

              end
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            

            

              
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            

            

              private
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            

            

              
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            

            

              # Check if the provider is supported
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            

            

              # @param provider_name [String] Name of the provider
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            

            

              # @raise [BaseAdapter::UnsupportedFormatError] If the provider is not supported
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            

            

              def self.check_provider_support(provider_name)
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            

            

                unless SUPPORTED_PROVIDERS.include?(provider_name)
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            

            

                  raise BaseAdapter::UnsupportedFormatError.new("No adapter available for provider #{provider_name}")
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            

            

                end
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            

            

              end
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            

            

              
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            

            

              # Create and return an adapter instance
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            

            

              # @param adapter_class [Class] Adapter class
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            

            

              # @param provider_name [String] Provider name
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            

            

              # @return [BaseAdapter] Adapter instance
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            

            

              def self.create_adapter_instance(adapter_class, provider_name)
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            

            

                adapter_class.new(provider_name)
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            

            

              end
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            

            

              
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            

            

              # Raise appropriate error for unsupported format
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            

            

              # @param provider_name [String] Provider name
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            

            

              # @param format_type [String] Format type description (e.g., "file extension", "content type")
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            

            

              # @param format_value [String] Actual format value
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            

            

              # @raise [ExchangeRateErrors::UnsupportedFormatError] Standardized error
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            

            

              def self.raise_unsupported_format_error(provider_name, format_type, format_value, context = {})
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            

            

                # Special case for CNB provider with content types for backward compatibility
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            

            

                if provider_name == 'CNB' && format_type == 'content type'
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            

            

                  raise BaseAdapter::UnsupportedFormatError.new("Content type '#{format_value}' not supported")
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            

            

                end
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            

            

                
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            

            

                context_hash = { format_type.gsub(' ', '_') => format_value }
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            

            

                context_hash.merge!(context) if context.is_a?(Hash)
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            

            

                
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            

            

                raise ExchangeRateErrors::UnsupportedFormatError.new(
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            

            

                  "No adapter found for #{format_type}: #{format_value}",
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            

            

                  nil, provider_name, context_hash
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            

            

                )
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            

            

              end
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            

            

              
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223. 
            

            

              # Get provider-specific adapter for file extension
          
      224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    224. 
            

            

              # @param provider_name [String] Provider name
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            

            

              # @param ext [String] File extension
          
      226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    226. 
            

            

              # @return [Class, nil] Adapter class or nil if not found
          
      227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    227. 
            

            

              def self.provider_adapter_for_extension(provider_name, ext)
          
      228. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    228. 
            

            

                # Map extensions to formats
          
      229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    229. 
            

            

                format_map = {
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            

            

                  'json' => 'json',
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            

            

                  'xml' => 'xml',
          
      232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    232. 
            

            

                  'txt' => 'txt',
          
      233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    233. 
            

            

                  'text' => 'text',
          
      234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    234. 
            

            

                  'csv' => 'csv'
          
      235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    235. 
            

            

                }
          
      236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    236. 
            

            

                
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237. 
            

            

                format = format_map[ext]
          
      238. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    238. 
            

            

                return nil unless format
          
      239. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    239. 
            

            

                
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            

            

                @@registry.provider_adapter(provider_name, format)
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241. 
            

            

              end
          
      242. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    242. 
            

            

              
          
      243. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    243. 
            

            

              # Get provider-specific adapter for content type
          
      244. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    244. 
            

            

              # @param provider_name [String] Provider name
          
      245. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    245. 
            

            

              # @param content_type [String] Content type
          
      246. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    246. 
            

            

              # @return [Class, nil] Adapter class or nil if not found
          
      247. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    247. 
            

            

              def self.provider_adapter_for_content_type(provider_name, content_type)
          
      248. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    248. 
            

            

                return nil unless content_type
          
      249. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    249. 
            

            

                
          
      250. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    250. 
            

            

                if Utils::FormatHelper::ContentTypeDetection.is_json_content_type?(content_type)
          
      251. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    251. 
            

            

                  @@registry.provider_adapter(provider_name, 'json')
          
      252. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    252. 
            

            

                elsif Utils::FormatHelper::ContentTypeDetection.is_xml_content_type?(content_type)
          
      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253. 
            

            

                  @@registry.provider_adapter(provider_name, 'xml')
          
      254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    254. 
            

            

                elsif Utils::FormatHelper::ContentTypeDetection.is_txt_content_type?(content_type)
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            

            

                  # Try txt first, then fall back to text or csv
          
      256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    256. 
            

            

                  @@registry.provider_adapter(provider_name, 'txt') || 
          
      257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    257. 
            

            

                  @@registry.provider_adapter(provider_name, 'text') ||
          
      258. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    258. 
            

            

                  @@registry.provider_adapter(provider_name, 'csv')
          
      259. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    259. 
            

            

                end
          
      260. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    260. 
            

            

              end
          
      261. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    261. 
            

            

              
          
      262. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    262. 
            

            

              # Find an adapter for a file extension
          
      263. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    263. 
            

            

              # @param provider_name [String] Name of the provider
          
      264. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    264. 
            

            

              # @param ext [String] Normalized extension
          
      265. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    265. 
            

            

              # @return [Class, nil] Adapter class or nil if not found
          
      266. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    266. 
            

            

              def self.find_adapter_for_extension(provider_name, ext)
          
      267. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    267. 
            

            

                # Try provider-specific adapter first
          
      268. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    268. 
            

            

                provider_adapter = provider_adapter_for_extension(provider_name, ext)
          
      269. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    269. 
            

            

                return provider_adapter if provider_adapter
          
      270. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    270. 
            

            

                
          
      271. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    271. 
            

            

                # Fallback to standard extension adapters
          
      272. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    272. 
            

            

                @@registry.extension_adapter(ext)
          
      273. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    273. 
            

            

              end
          
      274. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    274. 
            

            

              
          
      275. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    275. 
            

            

              # Find a standard adapter that supports a content type
          
      276. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    276. 
            

            

              # @param content_type [String] Content type
          
      277. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    277. 
            

            

              # @return [Class, nil] Adapter class or nil if not found
          
      278. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    278. 
            

            

              def self.find_standard_adapter_for_content_type(content_type)
          
      279. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    279. 
            

            

                # Try each adapter in priority order
          
      280. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    280. 
            

            

                @@registry.standard_adapters.each do |adapter_class|
          
      281. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    281. 
            

            

                  adapter = adapter_class.new(nil) # Temporary instance just to check compatibility
          
      282. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    282. 
            

            

                  return adapter_class if adapter.supports_content_type?(content_type)
          
      283. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    283. 
            

            

                end
          
      284. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    284. 
            

            

                nil
          
      285. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    285. 
            

            

              end
          
      286. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    286. 
            

            

              
          
      287. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    287. 
            

            

              # Detect appropriate adapter class based on content inspection
          
      288. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    288. 
            

            

              # @param provider_name [String] Provider name
          
      289. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    289. 
            

            

              # @param content_str [String] Content as string
          
      290. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    290. 
            

            

              # @return [Class, nil] Adapter class or nil if content type can't be detected
          
      291. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    291. 
            

            

              def self.detect_adapter_from_content(provider_name, content_str)
          
      292. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    292. 
            

            

                # Check for provider-specific content handling
          
      293. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    293. 
            

            

                if provider_name == 'CNB'
          
      294. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    294. 
            

            

                  if Utils::FormatHelper::ContentTypeDetection.looks_like_xml?(content_str)
          
      295. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    295. 
            

            

                    return Adapters::Strategies::CnbXmlAdapter
          
      296. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    296. 
            

            

                  elsif Utils::FormatHelper::ContentTypeDetection.looks_like_json?(content_str)
          
      297. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    297. 
            

            

                    return Adapters::Strategies::CnbJsonAdapter
          
      298. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    298. 
            

            

                  else
          
      299. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    299. 
            

            

                    return Adapters::Strategies::CnbTextAdapter
          
      300. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    300. 
            

            

                  end
          
      301. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    301. 
            

            

                end
          
      302. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    302. 
            

            

                
          
      303. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    303. 
            

            

                # For generic content, use standard adapters to detect format
          
      304. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    304. 
            

            

                if Utils::FormatHelper::ContentTypeDetection.looks_like_xml?(content_str)
          
      305. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    305. 
            

            

                  return XmlAdapter
          
      306. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    306. 
            

            

                elsif Utils::FormatHelper::ContentTypeDetection.looks_like_json?(content_str)
          
      307. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    307. 
            

            

                  return JsonAdapter
          
      308. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    308. 
            

            

                else
          
      309. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    309. 
            

            

                  return TxtAdapter
          
      310. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    310. 
            

            

                end
          
      311. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    311. 
            

            

              end
          
      312. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    312. 
            

            

              
          
      313. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    313. 
            

            

              # Create the default text adapter for a provider
          
      314. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    314. 
            

            

              # @param provider_name [String] Provider name
          
      315. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    315. 
            

            

              # @return [BaseAdapter] Text adapter instance
          
      316. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    316. 
            

            

              def self.create_default_text_adapter(provider_name)
          
      317. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    317. 
            

            

                # For CNB provider, use CnbTextAdapter for backward compatibility
          
      318. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    318. 
            

            

                if provider_name == 'CNB'
          
      319. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    319. 
            

            

                  return create_adapter_instance(Adapters::Strategies::CnbTextAdapter, provider_name)
          
      320. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    320. 
            

            

                end
          
      321. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    321. 
            

            

                # For other providers, use the standard TxtAdapter
          
      322. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    322. 
            

            

                return create_adapter_instance(TxtAdapter, provider_name)
          
      323. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    323. 
            

            

              end
          
      324. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    324. 
            

            

            end 
          
      325.

    app/adapters/base/base_adapter.rb

    0.0% lines covered

    138 relevant lines. 0 lines covered and 138 lines missed.

            require_relative '../../domain/currency'

            require_relative '../../errors/exchange_rate_errors'

            require_relative '../../services/utils/logging_helper'

            require_relative '../../services/utils/format_helper'

            class BaseAdapter
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

              include ExchangeRateAdapterInterface
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

              include LoggingHelper
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

              
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

              # For backward compatibility
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

              class ParseError < StandardError; end
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            

              class UnsupportedFormatError < StandardError; end
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

              
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

              def initialize(provider_name)
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

                @provider_name = provider_name
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

              end
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

              
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

              # Default implementation always returns false - subclasses should override
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

              def supports_content_type?(content_type)
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

                false
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

              end
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

              
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

              # Default implementation always returns false - subclasses should override
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

              def supports_content?(content)
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

                false
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

              end
          
      29.

              # Parse the data and convert it to domain ExchangeRate objects
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

              # @param data [String] Raw data from the provider
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            

            

              # @param base_currency_code [String] The code of the base currency (e.g., 'CZK')
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            

            

              # @return [Array<ExchangeRate>] Array of exchange rate domain objects
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            

            

              def parse(data, base_currency_code)
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            

            

                begin
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            

            

                  validate_data_presence(data)
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            

            

                  perform_parse(data, standardize_currency_code(base_currency_code))
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            

            

                rescue ExchangeRateErrors::Error => e
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            

            

                  # Re-raise ExchangeRateErrors
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            

            

                  raise e
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            

            

                rescue ParseError, UnsupportedFormatError => e
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            

            

                  # Convert legacy errors to new error classes
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            

            

                  error_class = e.is_a?(ParseError) ? 
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            

            

                    ExchangeRateErrors::ParseError : ExchangeRateErrors::UnsupportedFormatError
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            

            

                  
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            

            

                  raise error_class.new(e.message, e, @provider_name)
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            

            

                rescue => e
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            

            

                  # Convert unexpected errors to ParseError
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            

            

                  raise ExchangeRateErrors::ParseError.new(
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            

            

                    "Error parsing data: #{e.message}", e, @provider_name
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            

            

                  )
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            

                end
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            

            

              end
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            

            

              
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            

            

              # Implement this method in subclasses to do the actual parsing
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            

            

              # @param data [String] Raw data from the provider
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            

            

              # @param base_currency_code [String] The code of the base currency
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            

            

              # @return [Array<ExchangeRate>] Array of exchange rate domain objects
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            

            

              def perform_parse(data, base_currency_code)
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            

            

                raise NotImplementedError, "Subclasses must implement perform_parse"
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            

            

              end
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            

            

              
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            

            

              protected
          
      64.

              # Delegate to utility functions

              def ensure_utf8_encoding(data, source_encoding = 'UTF-8')
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            

            

                begin
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            

            

                  Utils::FormatHelper.ensure_utf8_encoding(data, source_encoding)
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            

            

                rescue => e
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            

            

                  raise ExchangeRateErrors::ParseError.new(e.message, e, @provider_name)
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            

            

                end
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            

            

              end
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            

            

              
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            

            

              def extract_date(date_str)
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            

            

                Utils::FormatHelper.extract_date(date_str) || Date.today
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            

            

              end
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            

            

              
          
      78.

              def standardize_currency_code(code)
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            

            

                Utils::FormatHelper.standardize_currency_code(code)

      81.

              def parse_rate_value(value)

              def parse_amount(amount_str, currency_code = nil)

              # Create a domain Currency object
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            

            

              # @param code [String] Currency code
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            

            

              # @param name [String] Optional currency name
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            

            

              # @return [Currency] Domain currency object
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            

            

              def create_currency(code, name = nil)
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            

            

                Currency.new(code, name)
          
      96.

              end
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            

            

              
          
      98.

              # Create an exchange rate object from component parts
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            

            

              # @param base_currency [String] Base currency code
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            

            

              # @param target_currency [String] Target currency code
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            

            

              # @param rate [Float] Exchange rate value
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            

            

              # @param amount [Integer] Amount for normalization (default: 1)
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            

            

              # @param date [Date] Date of the rate (default: today)
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            

            

              # @return [ExchangeRate] Exchange rate object
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            

            

              def create_exchange_rate(base_currency, target_currency, rate, amount = 1, date = Date.today)
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            

            

                from = Currency.new(base_currency)
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            

            

                to = Currency.new(target_currency)
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            

            

                
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            

            

                # Normalize the rate based on amount (e.g., if rate is for 100 units, divide by 100)
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            

            

                normalized_rate = amount.is_a?(Numeric) ? rate / amount.to_f : rate
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            

            

                
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            

            

                ExchangeRate.new(
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            

            

                  from: from,
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            

            

                  to: to,
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            

            

                  rate: normalized_rate,
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            

            

                  date: date.is_a?(Date) ? date : Date.today
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            

            

                )
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            

            

              end
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            

            

              
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            

            

              # Validate that the rate value is valid
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            

            

              # @param rate_str [String] Rate as string
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            

            

              # @return [Float] Parsed rate value
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            

            

              # @raise [ParseError] If the rate is not valid
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            

            

              def validate_rate(rate_str)
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            

            

                rate = parse_rate_value(rate_str)
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            

            

                if rate <= 0
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            

            

                  raise ParseError, "Invalid rate value: #{rate_str}. Must be greater than 0."
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            

            

                end
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            

            

                rate
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            

            

              end
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            

            

              
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            

            

              # Ensure data is provided
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            

            

              # @param data [String] Data to validate
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            

            

              # @raise [ParseError] If data is missing or empty
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            

            

              def validate_data_presence(data)
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            

            

                unless data && !data.to_s.strip.empty?
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            

            

                  raise ExchangeRateErrors::ValidationError.new(
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            

            

                    "Empty data provided to #{self.class.name}",
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            

            

                    nil, @provider_name
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            

            

                  )
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            

            

                end
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            

            

              end
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            

            

              
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            

            

              # Log an error
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            

            

              # @param message [String] Error message
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            

            

              # @param level [Symbol] Log level
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            

            

              def log_error(message, level = :error)
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            

            

                if defined?(Rails)
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            

            

                  case level
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            

            

                  when :warn, :warning
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.warn(message)
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            

            

                  when :info
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.info(message)
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            

            

                  else
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.error(message)
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            

            

                  end
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            

            

                else
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            

            

                  warn("[#{level.to_s.upcase}] #{message}")
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            

            

                end
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            

            

              end
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            

            

              
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            

            

              # Parse rate value from various formats to float
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            

            

              # @param rate_str [String] Rate as string
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            

            

              # @param currency_code [String] Currency code for error message
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            

            

              # @return [Float] Parsed rate value
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            

            

              def parse_rate(rate_str, currency_code)
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            

            

                rate_str = rate_str.gsub(',', '.')  # Replace comma with dot for decimal separator
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            

            

                begin
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            

            

                  rate = Float(rate_str)
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            

            

                  if rate <= 0
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            

            

                    raise ExchangeRateErrors::ValidationError.new(
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            

            

                      "Invalid non-positive rate '#{rate_str}' for currency #{currency_code}",
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            

            

                      nil, @provider_name, { currency: currency_code, rate: rate_str }
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            

            

                    )
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            

            

                  end
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            

            

                  rate
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            

            

                rescue ArgumentError => e
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            

            

                  raise ExchangeRateErrors::ValidationError.new(
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            

            

                    "Invalid rate format '#{rate_str}' for currency #{currency_code}",
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            

            

                    e, @provider_name, { currency: currency_code, rate: rate_str }
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            

            

                  )
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            

            

                end
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            

            

              end
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            

            

              
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            

            

              # Validate that the amount value is valid
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            

            

              # @param amount_str [String] Amount as string
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            

            

              # @param currency_code [String] Currency code for error message
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            

            

              # @return [Integer] Parsed amount value
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            

            

              def parse_amount(amount_str, currency_code)
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            

            

                begin
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            

            

                  amount = Integer(amount_str)
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            

            

                  if amount <= 0
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            

            

                    raise ExchangeRateErrors::ValidationError.new(
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            

            

                      "Invalid non-positive amount '#{amount_str}' for currency #{currency_code}",
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            

            

                      nil, @provider_name, { currency: currency_code, amount: amount_str }
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            

            

                    )
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            

            

                  end
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            

            

                  amount
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            

            

                rescue ArgumentError => e
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            

            

                  raise ExchangeRateErrors::ValidationError.new(
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            

            

                    "Invalid amount format '#{amount_str}' for currency #{currency_code}",
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            

            

                    e, @provider_name, { currency: currency_code, amount: amount_str }
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            

            

                  )
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            

            

                end
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            

            

              end
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            

            

            end 
          
      207.

    app/adapters/base/exchange_rate_adapter_interface.rb

    0.0% lines covered

            module ExchangeRateAdapterInterface

              # Parse raw data into exchange rate domain objects
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            

            

              # @param data [String] Raw data from the provider
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            

            

              # @param base_currency [String] Base currency code
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            

            

              # @return [Array<ExchangeRate>] Array of exchange rate objects
          
      6.

              def parse(data, base_currency)
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            

            

                raise NotImplementedError, "#{self.class.name} must implement parse"
          
      8.

              end
          
      9.

              # Check if this adapter can handle the given content type
          
      11.

              # @param content_type [String] Content type to check
          
      12.

              # @return [Boolean] Whether this adapter can handle the content type
          
      13.

              def supports_content_type?(content_type)
          
      14.

                raise NotImplementedError, "#{self.class.name} must implement supports_content_type?"
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

              end
          
      16.

      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

              # Check if this adapter can handle the given content
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

              # @param content [String] Content to check
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

              # @return [Boolean] Whether this adapter can handle the content
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

              def supports_content?(content)
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

                raise NotImplementedError, "#{self.class.name} must implement supports_content?"
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

              end
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

              
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

              # Get the name of this adapter
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

              # @return [String] Adapter name
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

              def name
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

                self.class.name.gsub('Adapter', '')
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

              end
          
      29.

            end

              # Parse JSON exchange rate data

              # Expected formats:
          
      18.

              # Format 1 (object with currency codes as keys):
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

              # {
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

              #   "date": "2023-01-01",
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

              #   "base": "CZK",
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

              #   "rates": {
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

              #     "USD": 0.043,

    25.
