    7. 
            

            

              RETRY_DELAY = 1 # seconds
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            

              DEFAULT_TIMEOUT = 10 # seconds
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

              
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

              # Fetch data from a URL with retry logic
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

              # @param url [String] URL to fetch data from
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

              # @param options [Hash] Additional options for the request
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

              # @param max_retries [Integer] Maximum number of retries
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            

              # @param provider [String] Provider name for error reporting
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

              # @return [Hash] Hash with :data and :content_type
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

              def self.fetch(url, options = {}, max_retries = MAX_RETRIES, provider = nil)
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

                options[:read_timeout] ||= DEFAULT_TIMEOUT
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

                options[:open_timeout] ||= DEFAULT_TIMEOUT
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

                
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

                retries = 0
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

                delay = RETRY_DELAY
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

                
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

                begin
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

                  uri = URI.parse(url)
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

                  
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

                  # Use Net::HTTP instead of open-uri for more control
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

                  response = if uri.scheme == 'https'
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

                               fetch_https(uri, options)
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            

            

                             else
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            

            

                               fetch_http(uri, options)
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

                             end
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            

            

                  
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            

            

                  # Get content type from response
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            

            

                  content_type = response['Content-Type']
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            

            

                  
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            

            

                  # Return the response body and content type
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            

            

                  {
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            

            

                    data: response.body,
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            

            

                    content_type: content_type,
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            

            

                    status: response.code.to_i,
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            

            

                    headers: response.to_hash,
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            

            

                    last_modified: response['Last-Modified']
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            

            

                  }
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            

            

                  
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            

            

                rescue OpenURI::HTTPError => e
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            

            

                  # Convert HTTP error status to appropriate exception
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            

            

                  status = e.io.status.first.to_i
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            

            

                  message = "HTTP error: #{e.message} (#{e.io.status.join(' ')})"
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            

            

                  error = ExchangeRateErrors.from_http_status(status, message, provider)
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            

            

                  
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            

            

                  if retryable_error?(status) && retries < max_retries
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            

                    retries += 1
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            

            

                    sleep(delay)
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            

            

                    delay *= 2 # Exponential backoff
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            

            

                    retry
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            

            

                  end
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            

            

                  
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            

            

                  raise error
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            

            

                  
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            

            

                rescue SocketError => e
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            

            

                  error = ExchangeRateErrors::ConnectionError.new(
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            

            

                    "Connection error: #{e.message}", e, provider
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            

            

                  )
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            

            

                  
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            

            

                  if retries < max_retries
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            

            

                    retries += 1
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            

            

                    sleep(delay)
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            

            

                    delay *= 2 # Exponential backoff
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            

            

                    retry
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            

            

                  end
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            

            

                  
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            

            

                  raise error
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            

            

                  
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            

            

                rescue Timeout::Error, Net::OpenTimeout, Net::ReadTimeout => e
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            

            

                  error = ExchangeRateErrors::TimeoutError.new(
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            

            

                    "Timeout error: #{e.message}", e, provider
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            

            

                  )
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            

            

                  
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            

            

                  if retries < max_retries
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            

            

                    retries += 1
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            

            

                    sleep(delay)
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            

            

                    delay *= 2 # Exponential backoff
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            

            

                    retry
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            

            

                  end
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            

            

                  
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            

            

                  raise error
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            

            

                  
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            

            

                rescue OpenSSL::SSL::SSLError => e
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            

            

                  raise ExchangeRateErrors::SSLError.new(
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            

            

                    "SSL error: #{e.message}", e, provider
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            

            

                  )
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            

            

                  
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            

            

                rescue => e
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            

            

                  # Catch all other errors
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            

            

                  raise ExchangeRateErrors::NetworkError.new(
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            

            

                    "Unexpected error while fetching data: #{e.message}", e, provider
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            

            

                  )
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            

            

                end
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            

            

              end
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            

            

              
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            

            

              private
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            

            

              
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            

            

              # Determine if an error is retryable based on HTTP status code
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            

            

              # @param status [Integer] HTTP status code
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            

            

              # @return [Boolean] Whether the error is retryable
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            

            

              def self.retryable_error?(status)
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            

            

                # 408 Request Timeout, 429 Too Many Requests, 5xx Server errors
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            

            

                status == 408 || status == 429 || (status >= 500 && status < 600)
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            

            

              end
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            

            

              
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            

            

              # Fetch HTTP URL
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            

            

              # @param uri [URI] URI to fetch
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            

            

              # @param options [Hash] Request options
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            

            

              # @return [Net::HTTPResponse] HTTP response
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            

            

              def self.fetch_http(uri, options = {})
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            

            

                fetch_with_protocol(uri, options, false)
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            

            

              end
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            

            

              
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            

            

              # Fetch HTTPS URL
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            

            

              # @param uri [URI] URI to fetch
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            

            

              # @param options [Hash] Request options
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            

            

              # @return [Net::HTTPResponse] HTTP response
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            

            

              def self.fetch_https(uri, options = {})
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            

            

                fetch_with_protocol(uri, options, true)
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            

            

              end
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            

            

              
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            

            

              # Common method for fetching via HTTP or HTTPS
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            

            

              # @param uri [URI] URI to fetch
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            

            

              # @param options [Hash] Request options
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            

            

              # @param use_ssl [Boolean] Whether to use SSL
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            

            

              # @return [Net::HTTPResponse] HTTP response
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            

            

              def self.fetch_with_protocol(uri, options = {}, use_ssl = false)
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            

            

                http_args = [uri.host, uri.port]
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            

            

                http_args << { use_ssl: true } if use_ssl
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            

            

                
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            

            

                Net::HTTP.start(*http_args) do |http|
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            

            

                  http.read_timeout = options[:read_timeout] if options[:read_timeout]
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            

            

                  http.open_timeout = options[:open_timeout] if options[:open_timeout]
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            

            

                  
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            

            

                  # Set SSL options if using HTTPS
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            

            

                  http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_PEER if use_ssl
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            

            

                  
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            

            

                  request = Net::HTTP::Get.new(uri.request_uri)
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            

            

                  add_headers(request, options[:headers])
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            

            

                  
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            

            

                  response = http.request(request)
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            

            

                  
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            

            

                  # Handle redirects
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            

            

                  handle_redirect(response, uri, options)
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            

            

                end
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            

            

              end
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            

            

              
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            

            

              # Add headers to request
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            

            

              # @param request [Net::HTTP::Request] Request object
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            

            

              # @param headers [Hash] Headers to add
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            

            

              def self.add_headers(request, headers)
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            

            

                return unless headers.is_a?(Hash)
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            

            

                
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            

            

                headers.each do |key, value|
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            

            

                  request[key] = value
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            

            

                end
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            

            

              end
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            

            

              
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            

            

              # Handle HTTP redirects
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            

            

              # @param response [Net::HTTPResponse] HTTP response
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            

            

              # @param uri [URI] Original URI
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            

            

              # @param options [Hash] Request options
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            

            

              # @return [Net::HTTPResponse] Final HTTP response
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            

            

              def self.handle_redirect(response, uri, options)
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            

            

                case response
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            

            

                when Net::HTTPRedirection
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            

            

                  # Limit to 5 redirects to prevent infinite loops
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            

            

                  if options[:redirects].to_i >= 5
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            

            

                    raise ExchangeRateErrors::NetworkError.new(
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            

            

                      "Too many redirects"
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            

            

                    )
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            

            

                  end
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            

            

                  
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            

            

                  # Get the redirect URL
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            

            

                  location = response['location']
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            

            

                  new_uri = URI.parse(location.start_with?('/') ? "#{uri.scheme}://#{uri.host}#{location}" : location)
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            

            

                  
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            

            

                  # Follow the redirect
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            

            

                  options[:redirects] = options[:redirects].to_i + 1
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            

            

                  
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            

            

                  if new_uri.scheme == 'https'
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            

            

                    fetch_https(new_uri, options)
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            

            

                  else
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            

            

                    fetch_http(new_uri, options)
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            

            

                  end
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            

            

                else
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            

            

                  response
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            

            

                end
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            

            

              end
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            

            

            end 
          
      196.

    app/providers/base_provider.rb

    0.0% lines covered

    192 relevant lines. 0 lines covered and 192 lines missed.

            class BaseProvider
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

              include ExchangeRateProviderInterface
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

              include LoggingHelper
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

              
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

              attr_reader :metadata
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            

            
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

              def initialize(config = {})
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

                @provider_name = Utils::ProviderHelper.provider_name_without_suffix(self)
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

                
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

                # Apply configuration using provider defaults
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

                @config = Utils::ProviderConfig.configure(@provider_name, config)
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

                
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

                @base_currency = @config[:base_currency]
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

                @publication_hour = @config[:publication_hour]
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

                @publication_minute = @config[:publication_minute]
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

                @publication_timezone = @config[:publication_timezone]
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

                @content_type = @config[:content_type]
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

                
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

                # Fix: ensure url is set from base_url in the config
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

                @url = @config[:base_url] || @config['base_url']
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            

            

                
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            

            

                # Extract file extension from URL for adapter selection if needed
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

                @file_extension = @config[:file_extension] || (@url ? File.extname(@url) : nil)
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            

            

                
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            

            

                # Cache for supported currencies to avoid repeated fetches
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            

            

                @supported_currencies = nil
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            

            

                
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            

            

                # Initialize provider-specific metadata
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            

            

                setup_metadata
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            

            

              end
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            

            

            
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            

            

              # Set up provider-specific metadata with default values
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            

            

              # This can be overridden by subclasses to provide source-specific details
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            

            

              def setup_metadata
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            

            

                source_name = @config[:source_display_name] || @provider_name
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            

            

                
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            

            

                @metadata = Utils::ProviderConfig.build_metadata({
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            

            

                  source_name: source_name,
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            

            

                  base_currency: @base_currency,
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            

            

                  publication_time: format_publication_time
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            

            

                })
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            

            

              end
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            

            

            
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            

              # Format publication time for display
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            

            

              def format_publication_time
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            

            

                time_string = "#{@publication_hour}:#{@publication_minute.to_s.rjust(2, '0')} #{@publication_timezone}"
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            

            

                Time.parse(time_string)
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            

            

              rescue
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            

            

                nil
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            

            

              end
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            

            

            
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            

            

              # Fetch exchange rates and return an array of ExchangeRate objects.
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            

            

              # This main public method should be used by clients to get exchange rates.
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            

            

              def fetch_rates
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            

            

                # Raise NotImplementedError if called directly on BaseProvider
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            

            

                ensure_not_base_provider("fetch_rates")
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            

            

                
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            

            

                perform_provider_operation("fetching rates") do
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            

            

                  # Get the raw data from the source
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            

            

                  response = fetch_data
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            

            

                  
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            

            

                  # Parse the data using the appropriate adapter
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            

            

                  rates = parse_data(response)
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            

            

                  
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            

            

                  # Update supported currencies cache based on these rates
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            

            

                  @supported_currencies = Utils::CurrencyHelper.extract_currency_codes(rates)
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            

            

                  
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            

            

                  rates
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            

            

                end
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            

            

              end
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            

            

              
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            

            

              # Fetch data from the source
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            

            

              # Subclasses should override this if they need custom fetching logic
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            

            

              def fetch_data
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            

            

                perform_provider_operation("fetching data") do
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            

            

                  HttpFetcher.fetch(@url, {}, 3, @provider_name)
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            

            

                end
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            

            

              end
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            

            

              
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            

            

              # Parse data into exchange rates
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            

            

              # Subclasses should override this if they need custom parsing logic
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            

            

              def parse_data(response)
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            

            

                perform_provider_operation("parsing data") do
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            

            

                  # Figure out the right adapter to use
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            

            

                  content_type = response[:content_type] || @content_type
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            

            

                  file_extension = response[:file_extension] || @file_extension
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            

            

                  
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            

            

                  adapter = if content_type
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            

            

                              AdapterFactory.for_content_type(@provider_name, content_type)
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            

            

                            elsif file_extension
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            

            

                              AdapterFactory.for_file_extension(@provider_name, file_extension)
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            

            

                            else
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            

            

                              # Try to auto-detect from content
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            

            

                              AdapterFactory.for_content(@provider_name, response[:data])
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            

            

                            end
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            

            

                  
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            

            

                  # Parse the data
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            

            

                  rates = adapter.parse(response[:data], @base_currency)
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            

            

                  
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            

            

                  # Validate rates
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            

            

                  validate_rates(rates)
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            

            

                  
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            

            

                  rates
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            

            

                end
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            

            

              end
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            

            

              
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            

            

              # Centralized error handling for provider operations
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            

            

              # @param operation_name [String] Name of the operation being performed
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            

            

              # @yield Block to execute with error handling
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            

            

              # @return [Object] Result of the block
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            

            

              # @raise [ExchangeRateErrors::Error] If an error occurs
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            

            

              def perform_provider_operation(operation_name)
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            

            

                Utils::ProviderHelper.with_provider_error_handling(@provider_name, operation_name) do
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            

            

                  yield
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            

            

                end
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            

            

              end
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            

            

              
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            

            

              # Return metadata about the provider including:
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            

            

              # - update_frequency: How often rates are updated (:daily, :hourly, :minute, :realtime, etc.)
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            

            

              # - publication_time: Time of day when new rates are published
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            

            

              # - supports_historical: Whether the provider supports historical data
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            

            

              # - base_currency: The base currency for returned rates
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            

            

              # - supported_currencies: Array of supported currency codes
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            

            

              # - working_days_only: Whether the provider only updates on working days
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            

            

              def metadata
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            

            

                # Raise NotImplementedError if called directly on BaseProvider
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            

            

                ensure_not_base_provider("metadata")
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            

            

                
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            

            

                # Merge basic metadata with provider-specific metadata
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            

            

                @metadata.merge(standard_metadata)
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            

            

              end
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            

            

              
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            

            

              # Return basic metadata that all providers share
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            

            

              # @return [Hash] Common metadata for all providers
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            

            

              def standard_metadata
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            

            

                {
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            

            

                  update_frequency: :daily,
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            

            

                  publication_time: publication_time_for_date(Date.today),
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            

            

                  supports_historical: true,
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            

            

                  base_currency: @base_currency,
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            

            

                  working_days_only: true,
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            

            

                  supported_currencies: fetch_supported_currencies
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            

            

                }
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            

            

              end
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            

            

              
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            

            

              # Validate basic aspects of exchange rates that apply to all providers
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            

            

              # @param rates [Array<ExchangeRate>] Exchange rates to validate
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            

            

              # @raise [ExchangeRateErrors::ValidationError] If rates are invalid
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            

            

              def validate_rates(rates)
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            

            

                validate_rates_not_empty(rates)
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            

            

                validate_base_currency(rates)
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            

            

                
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            

            

                # Call provider-specific validator method if it exists
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            

            

                if respond_to?(:validate_provider_specific_rates, true)
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            

            

                  validate_provider_specific_rates(rates)
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            

            

                end
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            

            

              end
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            

            

              
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            

            

              # Check if rates array is empty
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            

            

              # @param rates [Array<ExchangeRate>] Exchange rates to validate
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            

            

              # @raise [ExchangeRateErrors::ValidationError] If rates array is empty
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            

            

              def validate_rates_not_empty(rates)
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            

            

                if rates.empty?
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            

            

                  raise_validation_error("No exchange rates found in #{@provider_name} data")
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            

            

                end
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            

            

              end
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            

            

              
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            

            

              # Verify all rates have the correct base currency
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            

            

              # @param rates [Array<ExchangeRate>] Exchange rates to validate
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            

            

              # @raise [ExchangeRateErrors::ValidationError] If base currency is incorrect
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            

            

              def validate_base_currency(rates)
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            

            

                incorrect_base = rates.find { |rate| rate.from.code != @base_currency }
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            

            

                if incorrect_base
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            

            

                  raise_validation_error(
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            

            

                    "Unexpected base currency: expected #{@base_currency}, got #{incorrect_base.from.code}",
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            

            

                    { expected: @base_currency, actual: incorrect_base.from.code }
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            

            

                  )
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            

            

                end
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            

            

              end
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            

            

              
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            

            

              # Get the list of currency codes supported by this provider
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            

            

              # This is a convenience method to avoid fetching full rates when only
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            

            

              # the available currencies are needed
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            

            

              def fetch_supported_currencies
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            

            

                # If we already have a cached list of supported currencies, use it
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            

            

                return @supported_currencies if @supported_currencies
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            

            

                
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            

            

                # Try to get the list without fetching rates if possible
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            

            

                execute_with_safe_handling do
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            

            

                  rates = fetch_rates
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            

            

                  @supported_currencies = Utils::CurrencyHelper.extract_currency_codes(rates)
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            

            

                end
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            

            

              end
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            

            

              
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            

            

              # Helper method to safely execute a block and return a default value if it fails
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            

            

              # @param default [Object] Default value to return on error
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            

            

              # @yield Block to execute
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            

            

              # @return [Object] Result of block or default
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            

            

              def execute_with_safe_handling(default = [])
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            

            

                yield
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            

            

              rescue => e
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            

            

                # If the operation fails, log a warning and return the default
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            

            

                log_message("Operation failed: #{e.message}", :warn, self.class.name)
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            

            

                default
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            

            

              end
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            

            

              
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            

            

              # Get the currencies supported by this provider
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            

            

              # This method exists for compatibility with the interface
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            

            

              def supported_currencies
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            

            

                @supported_currencies || fetch_supported_currencies
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            

            

              end
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            

            

              
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            

            

              # Check if a specific currency is supported by this provider
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            

            

              # @param code [String] Currency code to check
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223. 
            

            

              # @return [Boolean] Whether the currency is supported
          
      224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    224. 
            

            

              def supports_currency?(code)
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            

            

                return false unless code
          
      226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    226. 
            

            

                code = code.to_s.strip.upcase
          
      227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    227. 
            

            

                supported_currencies.include?(code)
          
      228. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    228. 
            

            

              end
          
      229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    229. 
            

            

              
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            

            

              # Calculate cache TTL based on provider metadata
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            

            

              # @param current_time [Time] Current time (defaults to Time.now)
          
      232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    232. 
            

            

              # @return [Integer] Cache TTL in seconds
          
      233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    233. 
            

            

              def cache_ttl(current_time = Time.now)
          
      234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    234. 
            

            

                metadata = self.metadata
          
      235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    235. 
            

            

                update_frequency = metadata[:update_frequency]
          
      236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    236. 
            

            

                
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237. 
            

            

                # Default TTLs by update frequency
          
      238. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    238. 
            

            

                ttl_defaults = Utils::DateTimeHelper.get_default_ttls
          
      239. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    239. 
            

            

                
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            

            

                # Use default TTL or calculate based on next publication
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241. 
            

            

                if update_frequency == :daily && metadata[:publication_time]
          
      242. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    242. 
            

            

                  Utils::DateTimeHelper.calculate_ttl_until_next_publication(
          
      243. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    243. 
            

            

                    update_frequency, 
          
      244. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    244. 
            

            

                    metadata[:publication_time], 
          
      245. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    245. 
            

            

                    current_time, 
          
      246. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    246. 
            

            

                    ttl_defaults[:daily]
          
      247. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    247. 
            

            

                  )
          
      248. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    248. 
            

            

                else
          
      249. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    249. 
            

            

                  # Use default TTL for this frequency or fall back to hourly (3600)
          
      250. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    250. 
            

            

                  ttl_defaults[update_frequency] || 3600
          
      251.

    252.

              def cache_fresh?(cached_at, current_time = Time.now)

                return false unless cached_at

              def validate_provider_specific_rates(rates)

    17. 
            

            

                # Verify all rates are positive (ECB-specific check)
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

                invalid_rate = rates.find { |rate| rate.rate <= 0 }
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

                if invalid_rate
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

                  raise ExchangeRateErrors::ValidationError.new(
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

                    "Invalid non-positive rate for #{invalid_rate.to.code}: #{invalid_rate.rate}",
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

                    nil, "ECB", { currency: invalid_rate.to.code, rate: invalid_rate.rate }
          
      23.

      24.

      7.

              }.freeze

              # Create a provider instance based on configuration
          
      12.

              # @param provider_type [String, Symbol] Provider type identifier

              def self.create(provider_type, config = {})
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

                provider_type = provider_type.to_s.downcase
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

                
          
      18.

                # Get the class name for this provider

    20. 
            

            

                
          
      21.

                unless class_name

                  raise ProviderNotFoundError, "No provider found for type: #{provider_type}. " \
          
      23.

                                              "Available providers: #{PROVIDER_CLASSES.keys.join(', ')}"
          
      24.

      25.

      26.

                # Load the provider class if not already loaded

    27. 
            

            

                unless Object.const_defined?(class_name)

                  require_relative provider_type + '_provider'

              # Create a provider instance based on application settings

              # @return [BaseProvider] Provider instance

              def self.create_provider

            class RedisExchangeRateRepository < ExchangeRateRepository
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            

            

              # Default TTL for cached rates (1 day in seconds)
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            

              DEFAULT_TTL = 86400
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

              DEFAULT_POOL_SIZE = 5
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

              DEFAULT_TIMEOUT = 5.0
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

              
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

              # Stats for monitoring
          
      13.

              attr_reader :cache_hits, :cache_misses, :errors

    14.

              # @param redis [Redis, ConnectionPool] Redis connection instance or pool

              # @param ttl [Integer] Default TTL for cached rates in seconds

              # @param prefix [String] Key prefix for Redis keys

              def initialize(redis = nil, ttl: DEFAULT_TTL, prefix: 'exchange_rates', pool_size: DEFAULT_POOL_SIZE)

    20. 
            

            

                super()

    21. 
            

            

                @redis = redis || create_redis_pool(pool_size)

    22. 
            

            

                @ttl = ttl

    23. 
            

            

                @prefix = prefix
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

                @fallback_cache = {}

                @fallback_metadata = {}

    26.

      30.
